c74object.name: cage.pitchfilter
c74object.digest: Apply pitch filters to musical data
c74object.description: Filters an incoming bach.roll or bach.score with a pitch filter given by a breakpoint function

inlet.description: The gathered syntax of the input bach.roll or bach.score, header included (thus obtained via a dump message).

outlet.description: The gathered syntax of the output bach.roll or bach.score.

method.name: bang
method.description: Output the result obtained from the most recently received input data.

method.name: list
method.description: A plain list in the second inlet is converted into an llll, setting the filtering breakpoint function (see llll).

method.name: llll
method.digest: Filter musical data and output result, set filtering breakpoint function

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the following:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message. To keep the representation invertible (i.e., to allow a bach object receiving a text-format llll to interpret it exactly as if it was native format, e

attribute.name: velthresh
attribute.description: Sets a minimum velocity for the notes to be output. Notes whose velocity is under this threshold will be deleted. Defaults to 20.

entry.name: Inlet 1 (llll)
entry.description: Original musical data. The gathered syntax of the input bach.roll or bach.score, header included (thus obtained via a dump message).

entry.name: Outlet 1 (llll)
entry.description: Filtered musical data. The gathered syntax of the output bach.roll or bach.score.
